name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Carpinteria

reviews.text: Just finished working with management at this hotel due to our dissatisfaction with the stay. We went from San Diego to San Francisco over 12 days and this was the most we paid for an overnight stay, and by far the hotel we were the most disappointed with. The ice machine was dirty, chicken bones on the floor next to it, big fresh stain on the couch in our room, carpets are very worn. Hotel is not located in a scenic area by any means...reminder in the room to make sure your vehicle was securely locked. Management took my complaint very nicely, and told me he would like to look into the 3 issues we had and he would call me back. After a week, I decided not to let it go and called him back. He apologized for me having to call back, but said he had a note somewhere to get back to me. He told me he had indeed validated each of my concerns and promptly addressed the ice machine, which needed to be shut down immediately and serviced. We worked out compensation for our stay, but that is not really the objective. Would have much rather had a pleasant experience to begin with. If we were staying in this area again, I would definitely stay in Santa Barbara instead.
reviews.title: Dirty ice machine, stains on couch, very expensive
Love Carpenteria
reviews.text: The hotel was nice, but I liked Carpenteria even more. The hotel is just a small walk from stores or the beach.

Staying here definitely put a damper on the vacation mood. We had 2 different rooms b/c our first was a handicapped room which we did not need/ask for. Plus it was VERY worn with shabbily completed repairs here and there and a TV with malfunctioning volume. Our 2nd room was not much better. This property has not been updated/remodeled as HI Express advertises and needs some attention ASAP. I also did not like that the outside doors were unlocked until 11/12 at night. If I would have known, I would have spent more and stayed in Santa Barbara to have the nice vacation relaxing feel continue. Definitely not a place to get comfy in. Overpriced.
reviews.title: Shabby, Beat Up Accomodations

reviews.text: I've stayed in quite a few Holiday Inns recently and it is clear they are making huge effort to be the best in this price bracket. All rooms seem to be recently refurbished. All new fixtures and furniture of a very high standard.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn is bumping it up.

reviews.text: Service, breakfast, pool, laundry all excellent. Rooms spacious and very clean. Even the garden and grounds are immaculate.
reviews.title: Great Value - amazing service!

reviews.text: We found the hotel conveniently located a few km off the highway. It is about 15 min walk to restaurants.
reviews.title: A good place to stop in easy reach of Santa Barbara
Good budget hotel stay
reviews.text: The rooms were comfortable and clean and staff helpful.
Not a holiday destination as such but a great place to stop.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located for a stop over, just a short drive or longish walk to the beach and the main shopping and restaurant area.
reviews.title: Room not worth the price! Better hotels for same price.

reviews.text: The building is a little dated, but is clean enough with all the facilities you want from this type and location.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Have stayed at this hotel several times over the last 5 years. Just spent last weekend here. Parents stayed here too. Just noticed several "little things" adding up that went wrong over the course of 2 days. First, my parents room was supposed to be a handicapped room with a walk in shower and two queen beds. Nope. And it wasn't cleaned and ready when the front desk clerk insisited it was. We walked into a dirty, unmade room. Maid apologised profusely and quickly cleaned. My room was supposed to be 2 queen beds (I had two kids with me). Got a king bed. Had to ask for roll away. No problem. One of my kids enjoyed the roll away.
reviews.title: Just average. Going downhill.

reviews.text: toilet paper holder was completely torn off and sitting on top of vanity. told front desk they needed someone with a screwdriver to screw it back into place. It never got fixed while we were there and I reminded front desk twice.
reviews.title: Nothing wrong, just expensive for what it is.

reviews.text: Hair dryer in my room didn't work, after I pushed reset button, etc etc. It never got fixed even though front desk said they'd sent someone over "right away'.
reviews.title: Great, clean hotel. Disappointing breakfast.

reviews.text: Mold in my shower/tub. And I mean mold. Yuck.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a beautiful area

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok. Pancake machine broken with a sign on it. Everything else fine.
reviews.title: Perfect for All

reviews.text: Got a last-minute room here for one night and got the AAA rate of $160/night, which, for a weekend night in the summertime, is a good rate for any hotel near the California coastline. Rooms were large and clean with no signs of wear and tear. Landscaping and pool area were kept up quite well, all in all one of the nicer HIE's I've been to (and I've stayed at a lot of HIE's). Service was decent enough (but we didn't have any special requests either), breakfast was the usual for HIE, and for you pet owners, it's pet-friendly. A good choice for the area.
reviews.title: Well-kept HIE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice feel. It's easy to find from the highway but also an easy walk to town and the beach. The rooms are good and the small pool and hot tub perfect for a bit of sun bathing. The breakfast could do with some tlc but that was our only complaint.
reviews.title: Nice well run hotel

reviews.text: First let me say that I have never had such bad service in my life. The general manager was the most rude hotel personal that I have ever delt with. The problem is they refiused to honor the rate that was quoted to us over the phone. The assistant manager even said he heard the employee give us the rate and never tell us we had to have a goverment ID for each room. Several of us called the hotel before our stay and they never said anything about the restrictions. When the manager was called on this and we said we would cancel our reservation his responce was "good then I will keep your deposit, sell your room for more and good luck finding a room else where" nice guy. Also the person who made the reservation is a two time Vet is this how we treat our war veterans.
reviews.title: Not honoring their rate

reviews.text: The rooms are big with two queen beds and a pullout couch and the rooms are updated. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. The breakfast is nothing to write home about, it's fine if you like carbs and sugar. The hotel is along the freeway but we didnt hear any noise. It's not cheap though. We got a last minute (day of rates) which was the lowest on internet and still almost cost $200.
reviews.title: Nothing wrong with this hotel. Just overpriced

reviews.text: So...I don't usually post reviews, but felt I needed to this time. This hotel is WAY too expensive for what you get. I appreciate that it's a dog friendly hotel (we have 2, but were not traveling with them). BUT....if you're going to be dog friendly, you must accept responsibilities with that. What I mean is, if you allow dogs, you better shampoo the carpets frequently. Yes, our carpets were riddled with dog pee stains. This is a $200 per night (minimum) hotel, and you have dog pee stains on your carpet?!
reviews.title: Not so Great

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Carpinteria
